Forall

Forall allows for the defition of types, whose behaviour is valid for any inhabiting type; they are universally quantified types.

Typical imports

import scalaz.Prelude._

Instance creation

Create instances using of or mk

scala> val nil: ∀[List] = ∀.of[List](Nil)
nil: scalaz.Prelude.∀[List] = List()

scala> val emptyMap: ∀∀[Map] = ∀∀.of[Map](Map())
emptyMap: scalaz.Prelude.∀∀[Map] = Map()

scala> val nil1: ∀[List] = ∀.mk[∀[List]].from(Nil)
nil1: scalaz.Prelude.∀[List] = List()

scala> val emptyMap1: ∀∀[Map] = ∀∀.mk[∀∀[Map]].from(Map())
emptyMap1: scalaz.Prelude.∀∀[Map] = Map()

Universally quantified Semigroup

scala> import scalaz.typeclass.Semigroup
import scalaz.typeclass.Semigroup

scala> def listSemigroup[A]: Semigroup[List[A]] = new Semigroup[List[A]] {
     |   def append(x: List[A], y: => List[A]) = x ++ y
     | }
listSemigroup: [A]=> scalaz.typeclass.Semigroup[List[A]]

scala> type Plus[F[_]] = ∀[λ[A => Semigroup[F[A]]]]
defined type alias Plus

scala> val listPlus: Plus[List] = ∀.mk[Plus[List]].from(listSemigroup)
listPlus: Plus[List] = $anon$1@28957eab

scala> listPlus[Int].append(List(1, 2), List(3, 4)) == List(1, 2, 3, 4)
res0: Boolean = true

Natural transformation

scala> type ~>[F[_], G[_]] = ∀[λ[A => F[A] => G[A]]]
defined type alias $tilde$greater

scala> val headOption: List ~> Option = ∀.mk[List ~> Option].from(_.headOption)
headOption: List ~> Option = $$Lambda$6285/1223640999@2aa23a01

scala> headOption[Int](List(1, 2, 3)) == Some(1)
res1: Boolean = true

scala> implicit class NaturalTransformationOps[F[_], G[_]](trans: F ~> G) {
     |   def $(f: ∀[F]): ∀[G] = ∀.of[G](trans.apply.apply(f.apply))
     | }
defined class NaturalTransformationOps

scala> val none: ∀[Option] = headOption $ nil
none: scalaz.Prelude.∀[Option] = None

Binatural transformation

scala> type ~~>[F[_, _], G[_, _]] = ∀∀[λ[(α, β) => F[α, β] => G[α, β]]]
defined type alias $tilde$tilde$greater

scala> type Option2[A, B] = Option[(A, B)]
defined type alias Option2

scala> val pick: Map ~~> Option2 = ∀∀.mk[Map ~~> Option2].from(_.headOption)
pick: Map ~~> Option2 = $$Lambda$6286/204605763@6920f377

scala> pick[String, Int](Map("hi" -> 5)) == Some("hi" -> 5)
res2: Boolean = true

scala> implicit class BinaturalTransformationOps[F[_, _], G[_, _]](trans: F ~~> G) {
     |   def $(f: ∀∀[F]): ∀∀[G] = ∀∀.of[G](trans.apply.apply(f.apply))
     | }
defined class BinaturalTransformationOps

scala> val none2: ∀∀[Option2] = pick $ emptyMap
none2: scalaz.Prelude.∀∀[Option2] = None
